page.title: 01Coast nr Barswick Orkney
page.content: Three quarters sea, the remainder coast and mainly moorland. With some farmland, mostly rough graing. about half a dozen homes are located in this block,all fisherman-crofer type holdings. The cliffs are fairly high and sels breed onthe inaccessible beaches and in caves. Barswick Beach hs no motor road access,andis reached only by a footpath. Barswick is a small haven from which a few lobster boats work. The castle of Burwick is a prehistoric earthwork,almost entirely detached from the cliffs,but accessible by a narrow footpath. The only accessible beach is at Barswick,and this is pebblyy.
